result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Hearing

Defendant Jeremy E Monroe appeared by video, in custody of Richland County Jail.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wynes heard on defendant's health issue and scheduled appointment for date of trial. Defendant heard. Appointment is for consultation with eye specialiest for possible surgery. Court heard. State heard and questions rescheduling for October 14, 2022. Defendant states he has not heard from his attorney and has witnesses he wants to testify. Court questions Attorney Wynes on contact with defendant to prepare for trial. Court heard and finds good cause to remove trial from calendar. Court continues trial to November 15 or 16 depending on trial in Richland County.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy E Monroe appeared by video from Richland County Jail.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes in court for Jeremy E Monroe.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wynes heard on status of case. Defendant heard. Defendant and Attorney Wynes go to breakout room. Attorney Wynes and defendant return to court. Attorney Wynes heard and requests a trial date. Defendant will still be in Richland County Jail. Victim heard. Jury trial date set.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy E Monroe appeared by video, in custody of Richland County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jeremy E Monroe. Motion to withdraw as counsel filed. Defendant heard and requests new counsel. No objection by Attorney Frank. Court grants motion to withdraw. Defendant has contacted SPD for new counsel. Status continued.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy E Monroe not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jeremy E Monroe. Attorney Frank makes court aware that defendant is currently in Richland County Jail on a $10,000 cash bond. Attorney Frank believes he will be in Richland County Jail for 3 to 4 months and asks for a continuance. Victim heard. Status continued.

Defendant Jeremy E Monroe in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jeremy E Monroe. Matter is not resolved, would like to set it for trial. Status date set.

Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

You may join this hearing by video using the following website: https://wicourts.zoom.us/j/600348151 (meeting ID: 600-348-151).  To appear by video, you will need a web camera and microphone.  If you are unable to join by internet using video, you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: 600-348-151). If you wish to appear in person, please contact Judge VanDeHey's Judicial Assistant at (608) 723-7826.
for Confidential Victim Impact Statement-Denied
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:30 pm ADA Anthony Pozorski appears for prosecution. Atty Frank appears by zoom. No appearance by Defendant. State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Atty Frank heard on calling Defendant right away. 1:43 pm Atty Frank appears by zoom and informs court Defendant was looking for employment in Baraboo; will appear by zoom. 1:47 pm Defendant appears by zoom with Atty Frank; waives ready and pleads not guilty. Not guilty plea entered. Defendant heard on not appearing today; looking for employment in Baraboo; thought it was zoom still. Court heard back in person, no longer zoom. Court with draws warrant. Status conference set for 4/13/22 at 2:30 pm; trial weeks 4/26 & 5/3.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall contact State Public Defender's Office today.
Defendant shall not have any contact with C.R.
Defendant shall not contact victim by social media or post about victim on social media.

Defendant Jeremy E Monroe appeared by video, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has court in Sauk County today so appears by zoom. Defendant's address is correct but is homeless. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests sig bond with no contact with victim and not to post about victim or contact victim on social media. Defendant heard. Court orders $1000 signature bond with conditions to contact SPD, no contact with victim, and no social media posts. Arraignment date set.
Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on March 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
